# unified-latex-lint

## What is this?

Linting functions for `unified-latex` ASTs. Lints are found in the `rules` subdirectory. Lints
that can be fixed accept an optional `{fix: boolean}` argument.

## When should I use this?

If you are building a linter for LaTeX code.

# Constants

| Name    | Type                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | Description                           |
| :------ | :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :------------------------------------ |
| `lints` | `{ unifiedLatexLintArgumentColorCommands: Plugin<void[] \| [{ fix?: boolean; } \| Label \| Severity] \| [boolean \| Label \| Severity, { fix?: boolean; }], Root, Root>; ... 7 more ...; unifiedLatexLintPreferSetlength: Plugin<...>; }` | Object exporting all available lints. |
